items.title: Fear & Gibson in contention for GB's first European gold since Torvill & Dean
items.summary: Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson are in contention for Great Britain's first gold medal at the European Figure Skating Championships in 32 years.

items.title: Faldo returns home after open-heart surgery
items.summary: Sir Nick Faldo is returning home after having "successful" open-heart surgery, the six-time major winner's team says on social media.

items.title: X is still having issues following an hour-long outage on Friday
items.summary: On Friday morning, X and Grok went offline for users around the world on both the websites and apps. Outage reports began spiking on DownDetector around 10:00AM ET, while Cisco's ThousandEyes outage map noted over 600 X servers around the world that were having problems. items.title: Liverpool keeper gets six-game ban after racism claim
items.summary: Liverpool goalkeeper Rafaela Borggrafe receives a six-game ban for using discriminatory language towards a team-mate.

items.title: Another certification confirms the vivo X300 Ultra's global release
items.summary: Late last month, the vivo X300 Ultra got certified for sale in Europe, basically confirming its rumored global release. Now, the phone has been certified in Indonesia by TKDN as well. It has the model number V2562, which was confirmed to be attached to the X300 Ultra name all the way back in Novembâ€¦

items.title: Senegal stand in way of Morocco's 50-year wait for Afcon glory
items.summary: The game in Rabat (19:00 GMT) pits the continent's top two teams against one another, with the North Africans ranked 11th in the world and the Teranga Lions eight places below them.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.
